intro: Notoxylinon flaviflorum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered notoxylinon, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Notoxylinon flaviflorum is often found in tropical and subtropical habitats, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
